newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-NAB says UK, Irish banks in good shape.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-NAB says UK, Irish banks in good shape.

text.p: National Australia Bank Ltd (NAB) said on Thursday its banks in Britian and Ireland were achieving good results and would benefit from improved economic conditions.

"We have begun a concerted effort to ensure our activities in the United Kingdom and Ireland are well positioned to take advantage of improved economic prospects there," managing director Don Argus said in a statement.
Argus said (NAB) had appointed Grahame Savage as the chief executive of Northern and National Irish Banks, succeeding John Wright who would leave the bank on March 4.
Savage, 50, had wide experience in banking in the United Kingdom including a number of senior management positions NAB's Yorkshire Bank, Argus said.
Savage currently is NAB's general manager retail financial services.
